query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 Mentr’ io dubbiava per lo viso spento, 2 de la fulgida fiamma che lo spense 3 uscì un spiro che mi fece attento,
query.result: 1 While I was hesitating with my vision extinguished, 2 from the radiant flame that extinguished it 3 came a breath that made me attentive,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
4 dicendo: «Intanto che tu ti risense 5 de la vista che haï in me consunta, 6 ben è che ragionando la compense.
query.result: 4 saying: "In the meantime that you recover 5 from the sight that you have lost in me, 6 it is right that you compensate for it by reasoning.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 Comincia dunque; e dì ove s’appunta 8 l’anima tua, e fa ragion che sia 9 la vista in te smarrita e non defunta:
query.result: 7 Begin then; and say where it is directed 8 your soul, and make reason that it is 9 your sight in you lost and not dead:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 perché la donna che per questa dia 11 regïon ti conduce, ha ne lo sguardo 12 la virtù ch’ebbe la man d’Anania».
query.result: 10 because the lady who leads you through this divine 11 region has in her gaze 12 the power that Ananias's hand possessed."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 Io dissi: «Al suo piacere e tosto e tardo 14 vegna remedio a li occhi, che fuor porte 15 quand’ ella entrò col foco ond’ io sempr’ ardo.
query.result: 13 I said: "May a remedy come to my eyes, soon or late, as she pleases, 14 which were put out 15 when she entered with the fire with which I still burn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Lo ben che fa contenta questa corte, 17 Alfa e O è di quanta scrittura 18 mi legge Amore o lievemente o forte».
query.result: 16 The good that makes this court content, 17 is the Alpha and Omega of every scripture 18 that Love reads to me, softly or loudly.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 Quella medesma voce che paura 20 tolta m’avea del sùbito abbarbaglio, 21 di ragionare ancor mi mise in cura;

Please translate each line literally into English.
22 e disse: «Certo a più angusto vaglio 23 ti conviene schiarar: dicer convienti 24 chi drizzò l’arco tuo a tal berzaglio».
query.result: 22 and said: "Certainly to a narrower sieve 23 you must sift yourself: you must say 24 who directed your bow to such a target."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 E io: «Per filosofici argomenti 26 e per autorità che quinci scende 27 cotale amor convien che in me si ’mprenti:
query.result: 25 And I: "Through philosophical arguments 26 and through authorities that descend from here, 27 such love must be imprinted in me:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 ché ’l bene, in quanto ben, come s’intende, 29 così accende amore, e tanto maggio 30 quanto più di bontate in sé comprende.
query.result: 28 because the good, insofar as it is understood to be good, 29 kindles love, and all the more 30 the more goodness it contains within itself.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 Dunque a l’essenza ov’ è tanto avvantaggio, 32 che ciascun ben che fuor di lei si trova 33 altro non è ch’un lume di suo raggio,
query.result: 31 Therefore, to the essence where there is so much advantage, 32 that every good that is found outside of it 33 is nothing but a ray of its light,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 più che in altra convien che si mova 35 la mente, amando, di ciascun che cerne 36 il vero in che si fonda questa prova.
query.result: 34 more than in any other, the mind of each one who discerns 35 the truth on which this proof is founded 36 must be moved, in loving, toward it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 Tal vero a l’intelletto mïo sterne 38 colui che mi dimostra il primo amore 39 di tutte le sustanze sempiterne.
query.result: 37 Such truth my intellect discerns 38 from the one who shows me the primal love 39 of all eternal substances.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
40 Sternel la voce del verace autore, 41 che dice a Moïsè, di sé parlando: 42 ‘Io ti farò vedere ogne valore’.
query.result: 40 The voice of the true author discerns it, 41 who, speaking of himself, says to Moses: 42 ‘I will show you every value’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.

query.result: 43 You also discern it to me, beginning 44 the lofty proclamation that proclaims the secret 45 from here below over every other edict."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 E io udi’: «Per intelletto umano 47 e per autoritadi a lui concorde 48 d’i tuoi amori a Dio guarda il sovrano.
query.result: 46 And I heard: "Through human intellect 47 and through authorities that agree with it, 48 look to the sovereign of your loves, to God.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Ma dì ancor se tu senti altre corde 50 tirarti verso lui, sì che tu suone 51 con quanti denti questo amor ti morde».

query.prompt:

61 con la predetta conoscenza viva, 62 tratto m’hanno del mar de l’amor torto, 63 e del diritto m’han posto a la riva.
